com.ibm.team.repository.client.util
Interface IEventSource

All Known Subinterfaces:
IBaselineConnection, IConnection, IFlowNodeConnection, IItemManager, IStatistics, ITeamRepository, ITeamRepositoryService, IWorkspaceConnection, IWorkspaceManager
All Known Implementing Classes:
EventSource
public interface IEventSource

Represent a generic event source.

The Platform provides a general distribution network for events, called event sources. General-purpose listeners of type IListener can be registered with an event source and specific event category, entitling them to receive notification of events (IEvent) emanating from that event source that fall under that category. Event sources are arranged into trees. A listener registered with an event source automatically receives notification of events from any of the event source's descendents. The main category is the event's type.

Since:
0.5
See Also:
IListener

Method Summary
 void addGenericListener(java.lang.Object category, IListener listener)

Method Detail

addGenericListener

void addGenericListener(java.lang.Object category,
                        IListener listener)
Adds a listener to this event source. Has no effect if an identical listener is registered already. Implementers of these listeners should never block the calling thread to wait for user input. If it is necessary to prompt the user, this must be done asynchronously.

The added listener will be notified of future events classified under the given category. The notification will be via a call to the listener's IListener.handleEvents(List) method.

The client may register the same listener instance against multiple event categories. However, it is the client's responsibility to keep track of such things, and deregister the listener when it is no longer needed. Failing to do so leaks the listener object, which is hung on to by the event source. Even more seriously, the listener wastes time because it continues to receive event notifications in perpetuity.

Parameters:
category - the event category, typically the event type; must not be null
listener - the listener; must not be null

removeGenericListener

void removeGenericListener(java.lang.Object category,
                           IListener listener)
Removes a listener previously added to this event source for the given category. The listener is only removed from the given category; its registration vis a vis other categories is not affected. Has no effect if the listener is not registered against the given category.

Parameters:
category - the event category; must not be null
listener - the listener; must not be null

purgeGenericListener

void purgeGenericListener(IListener listener)
Removes a listener previously added to this event source for any category. The listener is removed from all categories it is registered under. Has no effect if the listener is not registered.

Parameters:
listener - the listener; must not be null
